alert.note: Alert for Clayton; DeKalb; Fulton; Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 26 at 10:29PM EDT until March 27 at 4:30AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Clayton County in north central Georgia... DeKalb County in north central Georgia... Southeastern Fulton County in north central Georgia... Central Gwinnett County in north central Georgia... * Until 430 AM EDT Monday. * At 1029 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Atlanta, Douglasville, Lawrenceville, Decatur, Peachtree Corners, City of South Fulton, Sandy Springs, Smyrna, Dunwoody, East Point, Duluth, Union City, Forest Park, Snellville, Suwanee, Riverdale, College Park, Fairburn, Lilburn and Chamblee. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
